intro: Cybianthus fulvopulverulentus subsp. magnoliifolius, commonly known as the golden sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive and drought-tolerant choice for native gardens.
